title: KIP-34 Parameter Updates (December 2020)
body:
I am proposing an update to various court parameters and parameters of some arbitrable applications controlled by the governor to account for changes in crypto prices, average gas prices, observed rates of coherence by court, etc.

Note that these updates were generated by the calculator in the following worksheet: 

https://colab.research.google.com/drive/1D7FoiUC-5SNOZ5NLzJbeRc-AoP2_zCE9?usp=sharing 

So you can see the exposition in this worksheet for the rationales that went into these choices as well as potentially play around with the calculator yourselves and eventually use it to create future parameter updates. Some of the estimations based on observed rates of coherence etc are listed here: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1Np-0JphMQwgim04ds16rpFoFrMstlTx78qIjqa5xjJo/edit?usp=sharing


One particular thing to point out is that I propose we change the stake multipliers in some of the arbitrable applications. Currently, most arbitrable applications either have winnerStakeMultiplier=sharedStakeMultiplier=50%, 
loserStakeMultiplier=100% or winnerStakeMultiplier=sharedStakeMultiplier=100%, 
loserStakeMultiplier=200%. Looking at applications with each choice, it looks like the rate of appeal is about the same (10-15%). However, all else being equal, going with winnerStakeMultiplier=sharedStakeMultiplier=50%, 
loserStakeMultiplier=100% has some positive effects on the minstake sizes we need for the courts that judge those cases, see the exposition in the calculator worksheet under “Arbitrator-Arbitrable Split Attack”. 



Thus, I propose to update the parameters in the following courts:

Proposed minstake :  620.0 PNK
Proposed alpha : 1
